CD433B1B01D1420D8873270F5E2AF59C.description: Provide feedback on own and/or peer business plans.

32DD77C19C3B4E6D9710BC71234EA7EE.description: Outline and present a plan for a small business in the early learning and health care industry in one’s community

1E4428CF9A804BFCA18F78E8A929DD38.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of owning a sole proprietorship, partnership and/or franchise business.

54B1E92DA35247E683A8E71C50AB094F.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of operating a small business, including a home-based business.

47DFD395DBF14050A8F43790DC76DA1C.description: Research the contributions that small businesses make to the local and Saskatchewan economy.

C90E59DD92EE4147B59C5F0B85AD9D13.description: Investigate small business, including home-based, opportunities in the early learning and health care industries in Saskatchewan.

96224073AC204781BCF34AC7B8837B1B.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

EFDEF06B6AE44D5E9C354D9278F71BF4.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

D3D2D76C24F34E4D84FC7BF4ED75D772.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

4D409DA202BA4DA087EB13F251CEEF6B.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

1523EEEC1F0E4B2DB303E2D6010216EB.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

8ED64F65D5A6452A81C13C8C7DE77FB4.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

80991539BFE74D78983FFD5606129E92.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

341FF9E5ECDA45E6815FC950236C2EBE.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

52240F708A3643598B8CC74F6CB0D1D3.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

D1AB7DB7B5ED4B3D81415A6B5A14A872.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

E68B01DE9B4A4A5AABAC406EE3678928.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

6797BE3F68C44151A1DCE80C933EF38F.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

6C260F2B93BB4BC8B9836F4DF45192AF.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

EF940596EFCD458789D94E2716DCD777.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

5C6FED618DF4450D89C33B86EA392B1F.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

D400279CAAD741A0BC6023E10F0183D1.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

D845D54294BC4DC2AEE7D0AE39D5E776.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement

79A83E7F92DC410EB5B7DB00756859B5.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

CF3EA43902794DA883ECEDACE11CBFEF.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

E8DC20498B654F4BB641E405E277F6B5.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous

CA4CE19A273C499BB6C52EB0380512A6.description: Research death rituals and practices from different cultural and religious groups.

030B898F97DD448AB4EC69C50E921D2F.description: Examine post-mortem care, including the possible responsibilities of the unregulated care professional (e.g., may involve repositioning the body, cleaning soiled areas).

E4ECD3AA24E94F80BB7AEBB42AE43610.description: Investigate legal issues surrounding death and dying such as advance directives, do not resuscitate orders and medical assistance in dying.

6EF903EEB44F4280A0F524E0C3424F9E.description: Identify the roles and responsibilities of each member of the palliative care team.

9E5F6431C27943B9BC97DE5EB1B3152E.description: Explore how to support the emotional, social, intellectual, spiritual and physical needs of a dying client as an unregulated care professional

29456229CC5C4BC69F8B253FE49DFC37.description: Examine Kübler-Ross’s five stages of grief (e.g., denial, anger, bargaining, depression and acceptance).

7DBBE51BF63647BEAB479B6657DE8C4E.description: Recognize that personal beliefs, culture and religion influence practices and attitudes about death.

59E4CE3C1F234AB1A01F8FE993F70CCD.description: Examine ways to provide end of life care.

A6E9C67F6D6C44329E73BBE648314B0C.description: Explain the unregulated care professional’s responsibilities when reporting abuse in a health care environment.

AA621D833B2647578D7358DD24217F92.description: Explain what to do with an abusive client.

6FF29787D6EF44BC84067F2AC8BB19C6.description: Recognize types of abuse of clients (e.g., rough handling, isolation) and health care workers (e.g., name calling, cultural slurs, physical attacks)

3458BE4A0D6D4125B3128C1328A2C15A.description: Describe possible types of spousal abuse, child abuse and abuse of older persons.

8033FD7DE6444B21BD0474AA45B8CB98.description: Identify signs of abuse (e.g., physical injuries, a change in behaviour, unpaid bills, lack of personal hygiene).

940CCD08E9904503966F7B12DB8D840C.description: Research the types of abuse (e.g., physical abuse, sexual abuse, emotional abuse, financial abuse, neglect, bullying, cyber bullying).

976E2455A389427B9CF4A97DDF82BD08.description: Recognize signs of abuse, bullying and harassment in a health care environment.

784D613749A44C75BA4E0D867A02DFA0.description: Discuss how to care for clients with speech and language disorders as an unregulated care provider (e.g., be mindful of non-verbal communication, be alert for signs of fatigue, reduce surrounding distractions).

EFF82878C900497289E8AE5C2B1F71E8.description: Describe the emotional effects of a language disorder (e.g., anger, stress, shame).

1007391A04F74738A3B830443271AECB.description: Identify communication aids and how they assist clients (e.g., communication boards, electronic devices, voice amplifier, emergency alert button).

3F733C738E22496BB32A1BA4E13921E7.description: Examine aids for clients with vision impairments (e.g., eyeglasses, contact lenses, Braille)

65D4F221F1E942D8BE15BE49BB9E0836.description: Describe the effects of hearing impairment (e.g., a change in behaviour, speech challenges, frustration when communicating, increase in other senses).

160721650CCB4C73B5D9D55FF238604C.description: Identify the signs of hearing impairment (e.g., speaking too loudly, leaning forward to hear, responding inappropriately).

157F644EBEBA41CEB805049ACB457405.description: Explore adult hearing, vision, speech and language disorders.

5732B591644748D784FA0A0CCA220D75.description: Describe compassionate caring for the client receiving assistance with elimination.

1DA73D18D1CA4619869064BE617FD367.description: Discuss why urine and stools specimens are collected.

C441FFB3ED98480794E19101B8C4D58E.description: Recognize how to collect urine and stool samples.

F2E66696D27E4C129960FFE1ECEA01B3.description: Explain why enemas or suppositories are given.

6E7418D11B6A4B4B9009142D0E658129.description: Describe the measures that promote comfort and safety during defecation.

132CF897BC334EA8AEDC514317519E2D.description: Identify factors that affect bowel elimination.

9EC65D8E0A424EECA32541FCB9F9CC75.description: Describe normal stools and the normal pattern and frequency of bowel movements.

87B397CE41E4415CB847AA0D9D76052E.description: Describe urinary incontinence and the care it requires (e.g., provide dry garments and linens, decrease fluid intake before bedtime, use incontinence products).

FD53F74F502A406C98CF53D6369DC200.description: Summarize the guidelines for maintaining normal urinary elimination (e.g., provide fluids as instructed by the care plan, help the client to the bathroom when requested).

B34D2DFD96F34D068D5DFD26E814C848.description: Identify the characteristics of normal urine.

C99B8F64CBA04738A8EECE789A8B25B7.description: Examine urinary and bowel elimination care

4DEAA653F505419BBD781AC000F5B87A.description: Discuss the purpose of intake and output records.

442EC5873B894696A3E47AF920CA9051.description: Explain the unregulated care provider’s role in assisting with intravenous therapy.

D06F17AF6E004CADA6C33D6D28D90AB0.description: Describe the purpose of intravenous therapy (e.g., to provide needed fluids, to reverse dehydration in the body, to replace minerals and vitamins).

361E4E91E4DB42CBA970D3402F704F87.description: Examine the purpose of enteral nutrition (e.g., a nutritional formula delivered into the gastrointestinal tract with a tube).

CC42482F0E83479BA717577CED510985.description: Practise feeding another person (e.g., ask how they prefer to eat, what they want to eat first, when they want to drink).

2712FEA99F5F4143BC2C0783560C8D16.description: Explain how to feed clients, including clients who may have chewing difficulties, swallowing difficulty, vision impairments

BA56755D3A9640798B3A344B2D2059F0.description: Investigate special eating utensils available for clients with motricity issues (e.g., curved forks, special grips, plate guards).

17BCEBE62CB246CD96DCC9E3098425AD.description: Describe special diets (e.g., sodium-controlled diets, diabetic diets, heart healthy) and why they are necessary.

F48112930B8F4BAF94A21A3B4C4A3F47.description: Explain why food safety is important (e.g., food storage, preparation and serving practices).

D0ABFD5B22C74F62ADB620334885D618.description: Research local meal delivery services such as Meal on Wheels.

6EBA33C5E2824DE2860A94C3E948017D.description: Describe how to create a pleasant client-centered dining environment.

93A19612847445CD961F0A9111B64DE9.description: Prepare and serve a meal for a fictional client with certain nutritional requirements.

106CE96B4FB14883AA6ADA19BC6A8871.description: Examine the social, emotional and cultural importance of meals and meal planning.

C63616FD5CF5482786C79E75FB1FB87B.description: Explain the role of the unregulated care provider’s role in meal planning and preparation (e.g., planning menus, grocery shopping, supporting special cultural dietary practices).

7BD5B1C7055C4FF9947FEB54D33265E8.description: Identify factors that affect food choice and nutrition (e.g., personal choice, culinary culture, allergies, finances).

51FE65A7BF32431CB1893BC5540A1BB1.description: Discuss how nutrient requirements change throughout the life cycle.

DEF3421AEA24470A8D930BB4B0349C17.description: Describe the structure and purpose of food labels.

8BA91D49607B4316AA9125D2DA27D2B2.description: Investigate the principles of Canada’s Food Guide, including Canada’s Dietary Guidelines

C86EF20A21014FB88B3098804EF345DC.description: Explore nutrition, fluids and intravenous therapy in health care environments.

0EBEE061C0C04ACD988025473BDF6109.description: Explain the concept of compassionate caring for a client with a chronic condition and pain.

77DBDE0E19344DEE9D64AF423695602F.description: Describe the effects of chronic pain on quality of life.

922C2551477748C999D6A2CC7C389AD7.description: Compare acute pain and chronic pain.

EEB1EF453568429EAD31173DC34ECD0D.description: Examine the relationship between chronic pain and chronic conditions.

AC120FAD55684A3CA4C1D3DC9BD10A76.description: Categorize chronic conditions according to body systems.

5BCD9B77346248D48B101358535683D1.description: Suggest care plan measures that promote sleep (e.g., comfortable room temperature, clean linens, darkened room, bed positioning).

2BF5AF83B21548B9ACC47C54C2BFBB0C.description: Discuss ways to address social and emotional needs of clients winding down to sleep (e.g., spending time, talking with patients).

F3F39BFF64DF4EECA0619E4E326643DC.description: Identify factors that affect sleep (e.g., illness, nutrition, exercise, medications).

4BA4724CF8364446A09C7A4368BA89C3.description: Describe why rest and sleep are important.

5C87FF4F669D4CCBBC4540906E1E0C84.description: Describe why comfort and well-being are important.

FB1EAAAE487543A88690AC254BCB9137.description: Identify elements in a room that promote client well-being (e.g., temperature, ventilation, odors, noise, lighting, feelings of safety).

E38C4D6B6BBD4A9BA548ECB4DC619550.description: Recognize that comfort is personal to each person and based on past experiences.

788508B729A64B35A8A09C2E9A076254.description: Explain ways to promote client comfort and sleep.

BC945455296342CEA9AF20DF3A5FF857.description: Identify proper care of wigs (e.g., storage, washing, drying).

4A00707E3A324229A4E129F3B259C009.description: Demonstrate applying compression stockings and elastic bandages on feet and legs

BB443BD74EDB4D409C85CF03395A6CE7.description: Describe how to dress and undress clients, including clients with intravenous tubing.

DED47285F7E2477B979A568E4E82696F.description: Experiment with applying makeup or styling hair on another person according to their wishes.

09BBB4EA11694D968F4A5677646DEFF3.description: Demonstrate appropriate nail and foot care procedures.

6644F2C0F6054F16986F5C13004609E9.description: Identify safety considerations related to basic nail care.

39ABD35D91A445909D212D971F47722B.description: List the steps to shave a client

DE992AE3B27A42909913278A7039EA94.description: Discuss how to provide culturally sensitive grooming

3B07AE9AC4D74F1B8611523AF2F49583.description: Explain how to care for matted and tangled hair

3A770688AC084BBF92AF9F6736193F01.description: Recognize conditions that may be related to a client’s hair care plan such as alopecia, dandruff and pediculosis.

75372F4BA52845DEBC159B868756D509.description: Identify the factors that affect hair care.

0C0DBAF9EC2242F48682A27EC418C277.description: Explain the importance of hair care and shaving.

7383F23A23994CAF973213A2A5FCAE2B.description: Describe the role and responsibilities the unregulated care provider in preventing the spread of infection.

6285DD94C0DD4BF4AE2299FFAC5AF681.description: Research disease outbreaks including pandemic and epidemic diseases that have had significant effects on the general population past and present.

0B8F2F6836C045DFA371FD96B2E1ED7C.description: Investigate the risks to unregulated care providers and patients when infection control is not adhered to (e.g., spread of disease to a more compromised population).

7909AC680B064EB59A571016434C018F.description: Demonstrate donning and doffing of personal protective equipment (e.g., masks, gloves, gowns).

80E0289A384D425284BC714BADD4FA56.description: Demonstrate proper handwashing, cleaning and disinfection techniques.

8587BC5CAD3E45B0843B81D0716A123F.description: Identify routine immunizations for infection prevention.

ACEB14C5D09C4AFE9B808610B4920F76.description: Discuss risk factors for infection (e.g., stress, poor nutrition, lack of sleep).

50A451F688E34B88990B83E1A0C21C44.description: Examine ways in which microbes are transmitted (e.g., the chain of infection) and steps to limit transmission.

7EAAB865E4754D97B8D8280769BA94BA.description: Identify the signs and symptoms of infection (e.g., fever and chills, nausea, rash).

48DC3FE2AAF142A1A738BDB660BF6912.description: Investigate the social and emotional benefits of exercise and activity for clients on bed rest.

13F8BD588C5741F8B7FBCFD997EC0A11.description: Explore range of motion activities that could be offered in long-term care facilities.

9328A328B8174D929784461FAC13A44C.description: . Demonstrate a personal range of motion exercises (e.g., abduction, adduction, extension, flexion, hyperextension, rotation).

1AA6EA74857842078BCD01B238BDD542.description: Recognize the devices (e.g., bed boards, foot boards, trochanter rolls, splints, trapeze) used to support and maintain body alignment.

3110F3EC508D4A2E8257378164E71C7D.description: Explore the complications of bed rest (e.g., contracture, muscle atrophy, hypotension) and how to prevent them (e.g., moving the client every two hours).

9DC6B6FD318448EBAA90F270E31EEE54.description: Differentiate among different types of bed rest (e.g., strict bed rest, bed rest with commode privileges, bed rest with bathroom privileges).

5F66FBA0D1FA44E5B08E557D7B22C54E.description: Recognize the importance of exercise and activity for clients on bed rest.

6AC39169186D4DA9B8BC751F3B3A3E56.description: Exercise and Activity for Clients on Bed Rest (Optional)

4462EE5E91C84FA2959537E32B6149DB.description: Investigate local adult community mental health services.

DE0658F8A0A74BDEBD6C460BA3E28CD5.description: Describe the effects of mental health disorders on families (e.g., guilt, blame, finances).

D7704DA7CB344772B054F9297A2EC710.description: Identify factors that may contribute to mental health disorders (e.g., biological factors, childhood experiences, stressful life events)

AD99A6F8E41F4F02B9ABFEA563C0D180.description: Describe how to support clients with mental health disorders.

67FF65A76735440B81FCD3934E12CF6B.description: Discuss care strategies to support clients with depression.

ADF0C8EB6B5D4D7F95E917DF328A3D1C.description: Examine causes, signs and symptoms of depression.

CB32C7D491A7493E936667ED7F460949.description: Research one or more mental health disorder such as acquired brain injuries, anxiety, depressive disorders, obsessive-compulsive disorders, schizophrenia spectrum disorders and trauma and stressor-related disorders

D3621DEF12E244B7AC225316064625FE.description: Investigate ways to support mental health of adults in health care environments.

A595C05254F84D50904E43C36FDC7AA6.description: Mental Health in Health Care Environments (Optional)

CC423B19F39541C495E9C90417E280EA.description: Research the impact of caring for family members with dementia on primary caregivers.

AD8E351B7A664CF7A47BD67FF8D182B9.description: Examine the role of the family in the care of the client diagnosed with dementia.

D4AD6E59DDEA4CF39F83D09DCA08DD0C.description: Describe the emotional requirements of the client diagnosed with dementia.

DEA6565766364DE8B5021A0F5C829315.description: Examine why depression is often associated with dementia.

AEF44ACCD4CE4B599BA26D73A23BF215.description: Describe how to support a client living with dementia (e.g., participate in introductions at every visit, talk about plans for the day, frequently remind the client of their location).

38C60846B0114CB88FDED508071CF7D6.description: Identify the different forms, causes and stages of dementia.

B0891A46C14A4302980FDCEC23FEDB54.description: Describe the signs and symptoms of dementia (e.g., forgetting names, misplacing items, becoming lost in familiar settings).

57953E35D10C440CB3E26C76C23D2FE6.description: Compare normal and abnormal mental changes related to aging.

32912990D28C418D95E3A39C435D75FC.description: Identify symptoms that could mimic those of dementia (e.g., dehydration, urinary tract infection, mood changes).

D19D2B57167E40B2884C9CA202F92DE0.description: Distinguish between disorientation, delirium and dementia.

AE663B5ACBD344B4A5DBB7737D45B211.description: Examine factors related to dementia in adult clients.

CE15D78958DD49E2A853B20DDA811A23.description: Investigate strategies to achieve work-life balance as an unregulated care provider.

7F65FEFBBC694B919E218C647C786DAA.description: Describe the effects of fatigue on role performance and safety for self and clients.

85E2D21F758247159B0ACE08EEFE4C7C.description: Identify factors that contribute to fatigue in the work environment (e.g., personal stress, work overload, scheduling, shift work).

174BBF7A19634AF9B096EA950AD91171.description: Explore strategies to manage stress in the workplace (e.g., develop selfawareness, take care of personal needs, think positively, ask for help, practise calming exercises).

68D20DA2B56A4F1FAAF92B7D3DEF542B.description: Identify the signs and symptoms of burnout.

189C391FA6E74A0E8CD69318F6B58120.description: Examine the physical and emotional-behavioural signs of stress (e.g., rapid pulse, increased blood pressure, nausea, irritability, burnout, anxiety).

29204F6EA7A14D31B86A8548E16DC548.description: Describe how stress can affect all dimensions of health.

A23801E720AE4662A610F9A742743D4E.description: Differentiate between eustress (e.g., healthy stress that gives a sense of fulfillment), acute stress (e.g., short in duration) and chronic stress (e.g., ongoing).

2B64FA34833B410BB7C9E40002D78EFB.description: Explore stress and fatigue management strategies for workers in health care environments.

C15161CDF57449B4AF0884B16A92C092.description: Employee Stress and Fatigue in Health Care Environments (Optional)

B03E519FB0E84CA99609F1BE53C1DADF.description: Explain how to respect confidentiality in all aspects of a client’s care.

61E44F9271D549C7862D6D8FAF24EC34.description: Demonstrate the use of the 24-hour clock.

6EB944BBD3114AAFB53FD3B634DB3C6E.description: Identify the types of information unregulated care providers are expected to report (e.g., physical and psychological changes, nutrition, mobility, glucose-levels).

01AF2CAFF398435E8172167663E8CDB2.description: Identify the types of documents found in a client’s chart (e.g., data forms, assessment forms, care plans, progress notes).

0756259CC3DF421AA8CBBF7349CA8483.description: List the functions of a client’s chart (e.g., communication, planning client care, accountability).

58745742782A41D1A0093D5FC121C5A7.description: Assess the criteria of an effective observation.

BDA983C59DFE43098DDAB6197A6059C5.description: Differentiate between objective (e.g., information gathered based on sight, sound, smell) and subjective data (e.g., information based on client’s report but not directly observed by others).

6F13ED39CACB4854BFFC0A384A13F593.description: Describe the unregulated care provider’s role in the care planning process.

823D3484EB6F45799F733E91F745423F.description: Examine the steps in the care planning process in health care environments and in the community.

82A1604063024A84ACFD7D95B607F955.description: Identify the function of the care plan.

C569674BEFFC4DC9A53E67F225675051.description: Examine how to plan, report and record client care.

54EDC269C2564E9F99AEB8211D39E9BB.description: Research options for First Nations to choose health self-governance in Canada.

5B61D2A0BE2D424AB31313F00E50EAE4.description: Explore health care clauses in the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP) Act related to Bill C-15.

684CB884F54A4BBF9147DF1EA148E4B5.description: Investigate how the federal and provincial governments collaborate to provide funding for First Nations to access health care.

0A510C192F3E4FE5B931C8C536B472AD.description: Investigate the historical significance of Jordan’s principle and the impact on health services.

DC2C318499774981877D92F7BEF63971.description: Explore Métis, Non-Status and Inuit health coverage in Canada.

8C900892257542CBA1B3E516976E867A.description: Explore the Non-insured Health Benefits Program for First Nations peoples registered under the Indian Act.

4783080E2F4C4534A1BB2EEB3CBB5843.description: Explore the origins of the relationship between federal health services and First Nations and Métis people (e.g., Treaty negotiations, Northern Intertribal Health Authority).

E85DD63B3E9B401CBCB7313D2B46C5DE.description: Summarize the Truth and Reconciliation Commission of Canada’s Calls to Action related to health (e.g., numbers 18-24)

1B1619E3FD914D4D8A5D43E9FCCFB7D0.description: Investigate health care services for First Nations, Métis and Inuit people in Canada.

4D106CE3E48D4E37AAC1547C6593F66E.description: Compare the Canadian determinants of health with the World Health Organization determinants of health.

C320C6E574AB433FBD9C90AAE12314DA.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of private versus publicly funded health care services.

494C46D294A340F591658DB809267CFC.description: Differentiate among primary, secondary and tertiary health care deliveries.

AD48BCC8384B4DCFA1B203573E6A511B.description: Identify federal, provincial and territorial roles in the Canadian health care system.

E1B1CEED71094A1A8714448B9ACBA496.description: Interpret the five principles of Medicare as listed in the Canada Health Act.

C294ABB903C94F949B076FE105B6116F.description: Research historical aspects of Medicare in Canada and how it has evolved.

93CD69A28F81435B99809AA412372D63.description: Examine the structure of the Canadian health care system

ADD772E44EFD4FAB93DFE1F1E951E577.description: Discuss the legal ramifications of accommodating or declining to accommodate cultural preferences in caregiving environments.

12EF964CE850425F9FAA1B522A7432F3.description: Describe the physical environment (e.g. visual décor, sounds) of a culturally safe caregiving environment
